page.title: 07Brighton Bombing
page.content: On October 12th 1983 there was an annual Conervative party Conference held in Brighton. There was no secrets held from the public. The large majority of the M.P.s concerned stayed at 'The Grand' hotel which was situated along the sea_front. The bomb was wrapped in cellophane so the dogs would not have been able to 'sniff' it out, it was also strategically placed to cause the maximum damage possible. The bomb went off at 2 am in the morning and many of the MPs were sleping. The damage was intense and 'The Grand'was scarred with a big hole in the front of the building. The IRA claimed responsibility for this act which killed several people.
